alert.note: Alert for Boone; De Kalb; Grundy; Kane; Kendall; La Salle; Lee; Livingston; McHenry; Ogle; Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 3:33PM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow producing intermittent white out conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected, with most of the snow occurring through early this evening. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph expected. Wind chill values of 25 to 35 below zero expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Falling or blowing snow will result in white out conditions with zero visibility at times, making travel extremely difficult. Power outages will also be possible as a result of strong wind gusts to 50 mph. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero tonight through Friday night can cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
